Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi knocked in Miguel Vargas with a single to left-center in the 10th inning for a 4-3 win.
Korey Lee hit a two-run home run in the second inning.
Lenyn Sosa hit a solo home run in the fourth inning.
Michael Stefanic executed a squeeze bunt for an RBI single, tying the score at 3.
Enyel De Los Santos got out of a two-on, one-out jam with a 6-4-3 double play.
Jared Shuster got Eric Wagaman to double play started by Nicky Lopez in the 10th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Davis Martin allowed two runs on three hits with four strikeouts and five walks in 3 2/3 innings.
Interim manager Grady Sizemore emphasized the team's resilience and the importance of finishing strong.
Post-Match Reflections: Grady Sizemore praised the team's effort and the potential for building momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sox remained tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in a season.
The game was the first two wins of the series and kept the team's playoff hopes alive.
